thread.title: Oman Air Appoints New Country Manager For OmanTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Oman Air Appoints New Country Manager For OmanTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Oman Air Appoints New Country Manager For OmanTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Oman Air Appoints New Country Manager For Oman
Oman Air has announced the appointment of Jamal Al Azki as Country Manager for the Sultanate of Oman (Centre). His new role is based in the Omani capital of Muscat. Al Azki took up his new position on 1 st July and previously held the position of Country Manager, UK and Ireland, for Oman Air.
Following Mr Al Azki’s appointment, Oman Air’s Chief Operating Officer, Abdulrahaman Al-Busaidy, said:
“We are delighted to confirm Jamal Al Azki’s appointment to the position of Country Manager for the Sultanate of Oman (Centre). He will be a great asset to this station, having previously headed up our operations in UK and Ireland.
“We wish Jamal every success in his new job and we look forward to seeing his positive impact on the Omani market”
Jamal Al Azki has worked for Oman Air since 2009. His career in aviation began with the Royal Oman Air Foirce, where he worked in air traffic control before moving on to sales and airport services roles at Qatar Airways. After a number of positions within the publishing and oil sectors in Oman, Jamal was appointed as District Sales Manager for Oman Air, based in Muscat. After fulfilling roles as Acting Country Manager in Oman and Assistant Country Manager in the UK, he was appointed as Country Manager for the UK and Ireland in 2013.
Jamal Al Azki commented:
“I am delighted to have been appointed Country Manager for the Sultanate of Oman. As proud Omani, it is an honour to take up this role at the heart of our national airline, especially as Oman Air continues its exciting programme of expansion.
“I look forward to building on the strong relationship that Oman Air enjoys with the travel industry in Oman, and with our many thousands of loyal and valued customers.”
Source:- Oman Air
